items.title: What Can Break the Shutdown Impasse?
items.summary: Significant milestones over the next few weeks could shuffle the status quo. For now, both sides remain dug in as the closure heads into a fifth week.

items.title: Mamdani’s Candidacy Roils Jewish Communities Across the Country
items.summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, has said he cannot support Israel as long as it is an officially Jewish state. More than 1,100 American rabbis are warning that the safety of Jews is at risk.

items.title: Prosecutors Who Called Jan. 6 Attackers a ‘Mob of Rioters’ on Are Punished
items.summary: The prosecutors were put on leave after filing a sentencing memo in the case of a man who showed up armed outside the home of former President Barack Obama.

items.title: Southern California Edison Offers Compensation to Los Angeles Fire Victims
items.summary: The utility whose equipment has been linked to the devastating Eaton fire in January is offering to pay fire survivors. But if they accept, they would be giving up their right to sue.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa Has Arrived in Cuba
items.summary: The storm hit Jamaica as one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes ever.

items.title: Radio Free Asia Will Halt News Operations Amid Shutdown
items.summary: Until this month, Radio Free Asia had successfully resisted Trump officials who had tried to render it obsolete.

items.title: Government shutdown could cost $14bn, congressional forecaster predicts - US politics live
items.summary: <p>Nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office says up to $14bn in GDP will not be recovered once funding is reauthorized</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/29/economic-loss-government-shutdown-2025">US could lose up to $14bn during shutdown, budget office says</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/29/affordable-care-act-insurance-prices-jump">Obamacare insurance prices will jump up 26% next year, report predicts</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>On X, </strong><strong>Adam Schiff</strong><strong>, one of California’s Democratic senators, criticized acting US attorney </strong><strong>Bill Essayli</strong><strong>, after a judge found that he was in the Los Angeles-based position illegally.</strong></p><p>Schiff <a href="https://x.com/SenAdamSchiff/status/1983371520400314675">wrote</a>:</p><p>“Unlawfully serving” in his role. Acting illegally. But left in place? While this Administration continues to replace career professionals with illegitimate political allies eager to do Trump’s bidding, Californians need better relief than this.</p><p>I do the American People’s bidding at the direction of their duly elected President. That’s how our Constitution works.

items.title: US could lose between $7bn and $14bn during shutdown, budget office says
items.summary: <p>Federal agency also estimates country’s GDP will reduce by one to two percentage points over shrinking demand</p><p>The US is set to lose between $7bn and $14bn as a result of the ongoing federal government shutdown, according to the congressional budget office.</p><p>On Wednesday, the nonpartisan federal agency released its estimates in a <a href="https://www.cbo.gov/system/files/2025-10/61823-Shutdown.pdf">new report</a> to the House budget committee as the government shutdown reaches four weeks.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/29/economic-loss-government-shutdown-2025">Continue reading...</a>
